translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with the Long Trainings
The Elder Supāricariyā’s Birth Story
“My name was Paduma,
a two-footed bull, a human chief.
After going forth from the Pava country,
the Buddha, the one with vision, taught the Dhamma.
There was a gathering of spirits
not far from the Great Sage.
They had come for a specific purpose
and were waiting for the opportunity.
Understanding the Buddha’s words
and the teaching of the Deathless,
with a confident and joyful mind
I rubbed his feet and attended on him.
See the fruit of the well-done,
of attending on the Teacher.
For thirty-thousand eons
I didn’t go to the lower realms.
For thirty-one hundred eons,
I was the one called Samalaṅkata.
Endowed with the seven treasures,
I was a powerful wheel-turning monarch.
I’ve realized the four analytical knowledges
and the eight liberations.
I’ve realized the six super-knowledges.
I’ve fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.”🔽Thus have I heard. This was said by the Elder Supāricariyā.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā supāricariyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Supāricariyattherassāpadānaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā supāricariyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽supāricariya therassa apadānam
translated: The Elder Supāricariyā’s Birth Story, the first.
